thread.title: Katie Price admits she hit "rock bottom" following shocking X-rated behaviour at corporate Christmas party
thread.title_full: Katie Price admits she hit "rock bottom" following shocking X-rated behaviour at corporate Christmas party

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Katie Price admits she hit "rock bottom" following shocking X-rated behaviour at corporate Christmas party
text:
Katie Price opens up about her X-rated behaviour (Photo: Copyright unknown) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Katie Price has admitted she hit "rock bottom" after she stripped off and ranted at guests at a corporate Christmas party she was paid to attend. 
The Loose Women presenter reveals she was struggling personally last year, and her shocking behaviour at the party was a culmination of months of feeling low. 
“It was the last shock. I was so low. I had started drinking really heavily," she said. 
“When I saw the footage of me at the corporate event I was mortified. Do people think I enjoy that? Time and time again, I’ve made a fool of myself. There is so much shame.” Katie Price attends the UK premiere of 'Fifty Shades Darker' at Odeon Leicester Square on February 9, 2017 in London (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
The star and her ex-boyfriend Dane Bowers were paid £13,000 to appear at EnergySave's festive celebration but party organiser Jason Rowan later asked for his money back because of her outlandish behaviour. 
Elaborating on why she felt so low, Katie added that she struggles with public scrutiny and also started to become resentful that she was the main breadwinner in the household. 
The mum-of-five - who hasn't had a drink since New Year's Eve - told The Sun on Sunday: "Sometimes I feel resentful about being the breadwinner but I know there is a real value in what he [Kieran Hayler] does for me and the kids.” The UK Premiere of 'Fifty Shades Darker' held at the Odeon Leicester Square (Photo: WENN.com) 
Last year, Katie ended up taking some time off from Loose Women to focus on her marriage, explaining that she wanted to work on her relationship with Kieran after lots of old memories resurfaced while she was promoting her book. Read More Katie Price at the EnergySave Christmas Party Katie Price 
She told viewers at the time: “It has been two and a half years and there’s lots of things in the book that are very traumatic for me and Kieran. Obviously we had therapy at the time and I thought we were over it and had moved on. 
“I thought I had dealt with it but you have to remember that when it all happened, I had just had babies and couldn’t take in everything." Like us on Facebook
